results.title: The Bigamist
results.creator_credit: Ida Lupino, Collier Young, Filmmakers and Republic Pictures Corporation
results.brief_description: A childless couple, Harry (Edmund O’Brien) and Eve Graham (Joan Fontaine) apply to adopt a child in their home city of San Francisco. The meticulous adoption agent, Mr Jordan (Edmund Gwenn) suspects something is awry and investigates every corner of Harry’s life before approving the adoption. He soon discovers that Harry has another life and another wife (Ida Lupino) in Los Angeles. Before Jordan reports Harry to the police he listens to his story. Ida Lupino was one of the few women directors working regularly in Hollywood during the 50’s, 60’s and 70’s. She also produced and wrote for both film and television during this period. Her acting career spanned fifty years from the 1930s to the 1980s.

results.title: Clash by night
results.creator_credit: Fritz Lang, Harriet Parsons and RKO Radio Pictures
results.brief_description: Barbara Stanwyck again plays the femme fatale, with her usual flair, in this adaptation of Clifford Odets’ Broadway play. Mae Doyle returns to Monterey, California, after seeking a life of adventure in the city. Disillusioned and bitter, she forms a relationship with her brother Joe’s friend Jerry (Paul Douglas). A quiet fisherman, Jerry is a decent hardworking husband, but Mae is drawn into an illicit affair with her husband’s friend Earl Pfeiffer (Robert Ryan). Marilyn Monroe makes a brief but memorable appearance as a young girl. “Clash by night” is the age-old story of the “Eternal Triangle” where one woman must choose between two men.

results.title: Damage (E)
results.creator_credit: Louis Malle, Channel 4, Skerba NEF and Studio Canal+
results.brief_description: Jeremy Irons and Juliette Binoche star in this Louis Malle erotic film about dangerous sexual obsession. Irons, a respected MP, becomes attracted and then involved with his son’s fiance Anna. Despite his promising career, his successful marriage to Miranda Richardson and the love he bears for his son, he cannot bear to give Anna up, and they pursue a dangerous affair which ultimately ends in tragedy. Martin, played by Rupert Graves becomes the innocent victim of their deceit. Miranda Richardson gives a strong albeit brief performance, while Leslie Caron makes a cameo appearance as Anna’s mother.

results.title: Brighton rock = Young scareface. Eight o'clock walk
results.creator_credit: John Boulting, Lance Comfort, George King, Roy Boulting, Associated British Picture Corporation and British Lion Corporation
results.brief_description: A double bill feature. “Brighton Rock” written by Graham Greene is a post-war thriller starring Richard Attenborough as Pinkie, a hoodlum. Pinkie marries a young waitress as his alibi for murder, then tries to get rid of her and a rival gang intervenes. “Eight O’clock walk” once again stars Attenborough in the title role as a taxi driver falsely accused of the murder of a little girl and his struggle with his wife to prove his innocence. A courtroom drama with excellent performances.

results.title: Cry the beloved country
results.creator_credit: Zoltan Korda, British Lion Corporation and Lion Films
results.brief_description: Based on the well-respected novel by South African author, Alan paton, “Cry the beloved country” is a film whose simplicity disguises the richness of its humanism. Two very different South Africans; one a wealthy white farmer, and the other a poor black priest, are united in the tragic deaths of their two sons. Despite the social and political realities of their country, the two extend a hand of friendship towards one another, and in that gesture raise the hope of peace and an end to the turmoil in South African society. Poitier, as a young preacher is excellent and Canada Lee gives a restrained but heartwarming performance.

results.title: Dead end
results.creator_credit: William Wyler, Samuel Goldwyn and Samuel Goldwyn Productions
results.brief_description: Based on the Sidney Kingsley play and scripted for the screen by Lillian Hellman, “Dead end” is one of the most acclaimed crime films. William Wyler directs the young cast of the Dead End Kids in this film which looks at the New York East Side as a breeding ground for potential criminals. Bogart plays gangster “Baby Face Martin”, Joel McCrae is Dave, the student architect trying to break free. America in the Depression is vividly portrayed and while the message of the film is less than subtle, the performances are excellent, as is the script. Co-starring Sylvia Sidney as the sensitive, caring sister of one of the boys.

results.title: Love finds Andy Hardy
results.creator_credit: George B. Seitz, Loews Incorporated and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Andy Hardy Series”.
The fourth film in the series and the first to put Andy’s name in the title. The story moves at a jitterbug pace along comic and heartfelt storylines. Andy (Mickey Rooney) is in a fix as he has made dates for the Christmas dance with steady girlfriend Polly (Anne Rutherford) and voluptuous Cynthia (Lana Turner). Meanwhile Dad (Lewis Stone) must oversee the household while Mum (Fay Holden) is caring for Grandma. The new kid next door (Judy Garland in the first of three fondly remembered Andy Hardy appearances) helps Andy out of his jam and how she does it is an absolute delight, as are her renditions of “It never rains but what it pours”, “In-Between” and “Meet the beat of my heart.”

results.title: Andy Hardy's private secretary
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Andy Hardy Series”.
Mickey Rooney is lovable as the evervescent teenager Andy with the stern judge father and understanding mother. Andy is about to graduate from high school and gets an inflated opinion of himself. He hires a social secretary played by Kathryn Grayson to sort out his complicated domestic affairs. Grayson does a superb rendition of Strauss’ “Voices of Spring.”

results.title: Andy Hardy meets debutante
results.creator_credit: George B. Seitz, Loews Incorporated and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Andy Hardy Series”.
Andy (Mickey Rooney) is dazzled by a picture in a magazine of a glamorous debutante (Diana Lewis). When Judge Hardy’s (Lewis Stone) crusade to save an orphanage takes him to New York City, Andy joins him in the hope of meeting his dream girl. However, the Big Apple shows little sympathy for a cocky, small town boy and his hairbrained schemes to break into high society backfire with disastrous but humerous results. Finally, his old pal Betsy Booth (Judy Garland), a high society girl herself, lends Andy a hand - and a tuxedo. This is one of the most entertaining films in the series and features Judy Garland performing “Alone” and “I’m Nobody’s Baby.”

results.title: Juno and the paycock
results.creator_credit: Alfred Hitchcock and British International Pictures
results.brief_description: This adaptation of Sean O’Casey’s play by director Alfred Hitchcock and his wife Alma Reville was lauded by the critics but Hitchcock was dissatisfied with the finished film. During the Dublin uprising, an impoverished family stand to receive an inheritance but things do not go as planned and the money does not come through. Their daughter is soon to give birth to an illegitmate child and their son is accused of being an informer.
